curated_text: Symbol: APD. Year: 2024. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense, Air Products, the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, Air Products Brasil Ltda, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, Amines, the Florida Department of Environmental Protection, the United States Environmental Protection Agency, FDEP, USEPA, PUI, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality, RCRA, treasury, Pension, Total Balance, EPS, Diluted, Air Products', Uzbekistan Asset Purchase, the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan, UNG, • Americas, • Corporate, Corporate, Business Segment Americas Asia Europe, India Corporate, Total Three Months Ended, 339.9 Equity, the "Reconciliation to Consolidated Results, Contents Americas Asia Europe Middle East, Consolidated Operating Income, Honeywell International Inc., Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Liquidity and Capital Resources 59 Pension, Critical Accounting Policies, This Management’s Discussion and Analysis, the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act, SEC, Business Segment Information, Supplemental Information, • Diluted EPS, LNG, Impacts Underlying, Total Operating Impacts, Non-GAAP Measures Adjusted, Research and Development Expense Research, Contingencies, the NEOM Green Hydrogen Project, Non-Operating Income (Expense, Variable Interest Entities, Financial Instruments, Business and Asset Actions, the " Reconciliations of Non-GAAP Financial Measures, Total Americas Sales Change, the U.S. Dollar, Nine Months Ended Change, Total Operating, Impacts Equity, Total Consolidated Sales Change, Total Europe Sales Change, Millions of U.S. Dollars, Income/Expense, Air Products Diluted, Americas Three Months Ended Nine Months Ended, CAPITAL EXPENDITURES Capital, NEOM Green Hydrogen Company, NGHC, the U.S., the "Capital Expenditures, Capital Expenditures, Contents Capital, World Energy, U.S. Dollar, Credit Facilities, Credit Agreement, NEOM Green Hydrogen Project Financing, The Board of Directors, the Board of Directors, Management’s Discussion and Analysis, Foreign Currency Exchange. Context excerpt: competition, environmental, intellectual property, regulatory, product liability, and insurance matters. We do not currently believe there are any legal proceedings for which it is reasonably possible, individually or in the aggregate, to have a material impact on our financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows. In September 2010, the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense ("CADE") issued a decision against our Brazilian subsidiary, Air Products Brasil Ltda., and several other Brazilian industrial gas companies for alleged anticompetitive activities. CADE imposed a civil fine of R$ 179.2 million (approximately $ 32 at 30 June 2024) on Air Products Brasil Ltda. This fine was based on a recommendation by a unit of the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, following an investigation beginning in 2003, which alleged violation of competition laws with respect to the sale of industrial and medical gases. The fines are based on a percentage of our total revenue in Brazil
